00001 // *****************************************************************************
00002 //
00003 // Filename :     MouseSystem.h
00004 //
00005 // Purpose :      Defines and typedefs for the "mousesystem" mouse region handler

00019 #include "mousesystem_macros.h"
00020 
00021 #ifndef _MOUSE_SYSTEM_H_
00022 #define _MOUSE_SYSTEM_H_
00023 
00024 // *****************************************************************************
00025 //
00026 //                      Typedefs
00027 //
00028 // *****************************************************************************
00029 
00030 #ifdef JA2
00031 #define _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY           // Undef this if not using the JA2 Dirty Rectangle System.
00032 #endif
00033 
00034 typedef void (*MOUSE_CALLBACK)(struct _MOUSE_REGION *,INT32);     // Define MOUSE_CALLBACK type as pointer to void 
00035 typedef void (*MOUSE_HELPTEXT_DONE_CALLBACK)( ); // the help is done callback
00036 
00037 typedef struct _MOUSE_REGION {
00038       UINT16                                                IDNumber;                                 // Region's ID number, set by mouse system
00039       INT8                                                  PriorityLevel;                // Region's Priority, set by system and/or caller
00040       UINT32                                                uiFlags;                                  // Region's state flags
00041       INT16                                                 RegionTopLeftX;               // Screen area affected by this region (absolute coordinates)
00042       INT16                                                 RegionTopLeftY;
00043       INT16                                                 RegionBottomRightX;
00044       INT16                                                 RegionBottomRightY;
00045       INT16                                                 MouseXPos;                          // Mouse's Coordinates in absolute screen coordinates
00046       INT16                                                 MouseYPos;
00047       INT16                                                 RelativeXPos;                       // Mouse's Coordinates relative to the Top-Left corner of the region
00048       INT16                                                 RelativeYPos;
00049       UINT16                                                ButtonState;                        // Current state of the mouse buttons
00050       UINT16                                                Cursor;                                         // Cursor to use when mouse in this region (see flags)
00051       MOUSE_CALLBACK                      MovementCallback;       // Pointer to callback function if movement occured in this region
00052       MOUSE_CALLBACK                      ButtonCallback;         // Pointer to callback function if button action occured in this region
00053       INT32                                                 UserData[4];                        // User Data, can be set to anything!
00054       
00055       //Fast help vars.
00056       INT16                         FastHelpTimer;          // Countdown timer for FastHelp text
00057       UINT16                        *FastHelpText;          // Text string for the FastHelp (describes buttons if left there a while)
00058       INT32                         FastHelpRect;
00059       MOUSE_HELPTEXT_DONE_CALLBACK HelpDoneCallback;
00060 
00061       struct _MOUSE_REGION    *next;                                          // List maintenance, do NOT touch these entries
00062       struct _MOUSE_REGION    *prev;
00063 } MOUSE_REGION;
00064

00071 
00072 // Mouse Region Flags
00073 #define MSYS_NO_FLAGS                                                         0x00000000
00074 #define MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA                                        0x00000001
00075 #define MSYS_SET_CURSOR                                                 0x00000002
00076 #define MSYS_MOVE_CALLBACK                                        0x00000004
00077 #define MSYS_BUTTON_CALLBACK                                0x00000008
00078 #define MSYS_REGION_EXISTS                                        0x00000010
00079 #define MSYS_SYSTEM_INIT                                                0x00000020
00080 #define MSYS_REGION_ENABLED                                       0x00000040
00081 #define MSYS_FASTHELP                                                         0x00000080
00082 #define MSYS_GOT_BACKGROUND                                       0x00000100
00083 #define MSYS_HAS_BACKRECT                                               0x00000200
00084 #define MSYS_FASTHELP_RESET                                       0x00000400
00085 #define MSYS_ALLOW_DISABLED_FASTHELP            0x00000800
00086 
00087 // Mouse region IDs
00088 #define MSYS_ID_BASE                                  1
00089 #define MSYS_ID_MAX                                         0xfffffff // ( INT32 max )
00090 #define MSYS_ID_SYSTEM                          0
00091 
00092 // Mouse region priorities
00093 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_LOWEST        0
00094 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_LOW                       15
00095 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_BASE                31
00096 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_NORMAL        31
00097 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_HIGH                63
00098 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_HIGHEST       127
00099 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_SYSTEM        -1
00100 #define MSYS_PRIORITY_AUTO                -1
00101 
00102 // Mouse system defines used during updates
00103 #define MSYS_NO_ACTION                          0
00104 #define MSYS_DO_MOVE                                  1
00105 #define MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_DWN               2
00106 #define MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_UP                4
00107 #define MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_DWN               8
00108 #define MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_UP                16
00109 #define MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_REPEAT      32
00110 #define MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_REPEAT      64
00111 
00112 #define MSYS_DO_BUTTONS                         (MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_DWN|MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_UP|MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_DWN|MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_UP|MSYS_DO_RBUTTON_REPEAT|MSYS_DO_LBUTTON_REPEAT)
00113 
00114 // Mouse system button masks
00115 #define MSYS_LEFT_BUTTON                        1
00116 #define MSYS_RIGHT_BUTTON                       2
00117 
00118 // Mouse system special values
00119 #define MSYS_NO_CALLBACK                        NULL
00120 #define MSYS_NO_CURSOR                          65534
00121 
00122 // Mouse system callback reasons
00123 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_NONE                                                   0
00124 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_INIT                                                   1
00125 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_MOVE                                                   2
00126 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN                          4
00127 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP                                 8
00128 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_DWN                          16
00129 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_UP                                 32
00130 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_BUTTONS                                          (MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN|MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP| \
00131                                                                                                                                                       MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_DWN|MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_UP)
00132 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE                                 64
00133 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE                                 128
00134 
00135 #define     MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_REPEAT                   256
00136 #define     MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_REPEAT                   512
00137 
00138 //Kris:  Nov 31, 1999
00139 //Added support for double clicks.  The DOUBLECLICK event is passed combined with
00140 //the LBUTTON_DWN event if two LBUTTON_DWN events are detected on the same button/region
00141 //within the delay defined by MSYS_DOUBLECLICK_DELAY (in milliseconds).  If your button/region
00142 //supports double clicks and single clicks, make sure the DOUBLECLICK event is checked first (rejecting
00143 //the LBUTTON_DWN event if detected)
00144 #define MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DOUBLECLICK      1024
00145 
00146 
00147 // Mouse grabbing return codes
00148 #define MSYS_GRABBED_OK                               0
00149 #define MSYS_ALREADY_GRABBED              1
00150 #define MSYS_REGION_NOT_IN_LIST           2
